prompt: <description>3D Model of a Rectangular Prism with a Cylindrical Hole Part 1: Top Rectangular Prism Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism is oriented such that the flat top is aligned with the X-Y plane. 1. Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.0, 0.6136, 0.0]. This will position and orient the prism correctly. 2. Begin by creating a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Draw the following lines to create a face: a. Line 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] b. Line 2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5455] c. Line 3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5455], End Point [0.0, 0.5455] d. Line 4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5455], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The resulting face forms a rectangle, and the rectangular prism will be built upon it. 4. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system, and extrude it by 0.3409 units in the direction of the normal. Part 2: Cylindrical Hole Create a cylindrical hole in the rectangular prism. The hole is tapered and has a flat bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.2557, 0.2727, 0.1534]. This will position and orient the cylindrical hole correctly. 2. Begin by creating a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Draw a circle with the following properties: a. Center [0.1193, 0.1193] b. Radius 0.1193 4. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.2386. 5. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the given coordinate system, and extrude it by 0.2727 units in the direction of the normal. Part 3: Center Cylindrical Object Construct a centered, cylindrical object inside the hole created in Part 2 with a flat top and a slightly tapered bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system. Set the Euler angles to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the Translation Vector to [0.283, 0.0, 0.1807]. This will position and orient the cylindrical object correctly. 2. Begin by creating a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane defined by the coordinate system. 3. Draw a circle with the following properties: a. Center [0.092, 0.092] b. Radius 0.092 4. Set the extrude depth towards the normal to 0.0 and the extrude depth opposite normal to 0.0341. 5. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.1841. 6. Perform a subtractive cut to remove the cylindrical object from the previously created rectangular prism and cylindrical hole. Upon completing these steps, you will have constructed the given 3D model of a rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center.</description>

prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The prism has sides that are parallel and top and bottom faces that are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal and the height is half the length of the sides. 1. **Create a new coordinate system**. Set the Euler Angles to `[-90.0, 0.0, -90.0]` and the Translation Vector to `[0.0, 0.0, 0.0]`. This will create a coordinate system for the 2D sketch plane. 2. **Draw the 2D sketch**. The sketch should be drawn on a plane defined by the coordinate system. a. **Create face 1**. i. **Create loop 1**. 1. **Create line 1**. Set the Start Point to `[0.0, 0.0]` and the End Point to `[0.6818, 0.0]`. 2. **Create line 2**. Set the Start Point to `[0.6818, 0.0]` and the End Point to `[0.6818, 0.75]`. 3. **Create line 3**. Set the Start Point to `[0.6818, 0.75]` and the End Point to `[0.0, 0.75]`. 4. **Create line 4**. Set the Start Point to `[0.0, 0.75]` and the End Point to `[0.0, 0.0]`. Loop 1 should consist of lines 1-4 which together form a closed loop. 3. **Scale the 2D sketch**. Apply a scaling parameter of 0.75 to the 2D sketch to obtain the correct dimensions. 4. **Transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D Sketch**. Use the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system to transform the 2D sketch into a 3D Sketch. 5. **Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model**. Since this is a new part, set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.0, the extrusion depth opposite the normal to 0.0, and use the NewBodyFeatureOperation. Set the sketch scale to 0.75. The dimensions of the final shape are: - Length: 4.3831e-05 - Width: 0.75 - Height: 0.375</description>
